channel.title: Publications on Stat 340 Applied Regression
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Stat 340 Applied Regression

item.title: (Class 19) Logistic Regression for a Binomial R.V.
(Class 16) Bernoulli, Binomial, and MLE
item.description: During class Recap Logistic regression and MLE Discuss Measures of Accuracy for classification Preview Lab Reading ISLR 4.3.1-4.3.5

item.title: (Class 15) Bernoulli, Binomial, and MLE
item.description: During class Bernoulli distribution Binomial distribution MLE Maximum likelihood for linear regression Maximum likelihood for logistic regression Reading ISLR 4.3.1-4.3.5

item.title: (Class 14) Interpreting coefficients and measures of accuracy
item.description: During class Derive a one unit change in a logistic regression model Understand how to interpret coefficients Compute Accuracy, False positive, True positive, False negative, and True negative Compute Positive and negative predictive error. Reading ISLR 4.3.1-4.3.5

item.title: (Class 13) Classification
item.description: During class Explore the classification problem Try past methods for regression Explore the logistic function Reading ISLR 4.3.1 4.3.2 4.3.3

item.title: (Class 11) Transform lab
item.description: During class Introduce LAB Work together on LAB

item.title: (Class 10) Transformations
item.description: During class LINE assumptions Transforming X CDF and PDF QQ-plot N assumption and E assumption Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 09) Bias-variance tradeoff
item.description: During class Bias-Variance tradeoff Prof Ray’s BV tradeoff Lab For Loops extra Crossval Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 08) Cross-validation Lab
item.description: During class LAB R cheatsheets Prof Ray’s R cheatsheet R cheatsheet R cheatsheet 2 R cheatsheet 3 R cheatsheet 4 Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 07) Orthogonal projections as a method of optimization.
item.description: During class Orthogonality Projections Orthogonal projection as a minimizer Hat matrix and regression as an orthogonal projection After class Checkout this cool example of orth. proj and regression (Courtesy of Prof.Ray) link Reading Notes. Our ISLR book doesn’t include this material.

item.title: (Class 06) Testing, training, and validation data, and the Bias-variance tradeoff.
item.description: During class Training, testing, and validation (3.3 of ISLR) MSE Bias-variance tradeoff Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 05) SSE optimization.
item.description: During class Minimizing SSE for MLR Start and finish hat matrix discussion Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 04) Lab on fitting simple, multiple, and polynomial models to Boston housing data.
item.description: During class Finish discussion on optimizing SSE Discuss Cov/Var Discuss (X’X)^-1(X’y) Lab

item.title: (Class 03) Polynomial regression, optimizing parameters via SSE
item.description: During class Multiple Regression Example of translating data into regression Polynomial Regression (3.3 of ISLR) Optimizing via SSE Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 02) Polynomial regression, testing and training
item.description: During class Warmup activity (in groups) Linear regression commands in R Setup GitHub Video overview Detailed instructions Please enter your name and github username in this form Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3

item.title: (Class 01) Technical setup and Matrix notation related to regression
item.description: During class Overview of course Matrix notation for multiple regression Ch. 1 of ISLR and Lin Reg Wiki After Class Todos Signup for our piazza page Piazza will be a valuable tool for asking questions throughout the semester. Reading ISLR Chapter 1 2.1, 2.2.1, 2.2.2 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 This material should be mostly familiar, but we will discuss the above during the first two weeks or so of class.
